name: Buttermilk (Chaas)
history: Buttermilk, known as Chaas in India, is a traditional Indian beverage. It's a staple in many Indian households, particularly consumed after meals for its digestive benefits. It's made by churning yogurt with water and spices.
description: Buttermilk or Chaas is a refreshing, yogurt-based drink, often seasoned with herbs and spices like cumin, mint, and salt. It's known for its cooling properties and is a popular choice to accompany meals or as a stand-alone drink.

instructions.title: Blend Ingredients
instructions.description: In a blender or using a whisk, mix the yogurt and water until smooth. Add cumin powder, salt, and black salt (if using). Blend or whisk well.

instructions.title: Add Flavorings
instructions.description: If using, add chopped mint leaves for a refreshing flavor. Blend or stir to incorporate.

instructions.title: Chill and Serve
instructions.description: Serve the buttermilk chilled. Add ice cubes if desired. Pour into glasses and garnish with a sprinkle of cumin powder or a mint leaf.

tips: Use fresh, unsweetened yogurt for the best taste.
Adjust the consistency by altering the yogurt-to-water ratio as per your preference.
variations: Add grated ginger or a pinch of asafoetida for a different flavor profile.
For a sweeter version, blend with a bit of sugar or honey.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh. Can be stored in the refrigerator for up to a day.
storage.instructions: Store in a covered container in the refrigerator. Stir well before serving.

presentationTips: Serve in traditional clay cups for an authentic experience.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh coriander or a slice of lime.
